--- title: Why? type: slides order: 1 --- # Why? === ## The Carbon Cost
Many disasters, such as the 2019-2020 Australian bushfires, are increasing in frequency and intensity due to climate change. This is mostly driven by increases in greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, such as carbon dioxide and methane gas The electricity we use to power our computing can be generated in many ways, some more carbon intensive than others Note: === ## Pollution and Water use
Climate change is not the only environmental cost Mining for raw materials and industrial processes involved in hardware manufacturing are responsible for a lot of pollution Water usage in energy production or in cooling systems for computing clusters Note: === www.esciencecenter.nl info@esciencecenter.nl 020 - 460 47 70
